quote: It's the possibility of having a dream come true that makes life interesting.
author: Paulo Coelho, The Alchemist

quote: I cannot fix on the hour, or the spot, or the look or the words, which laid the foundation. It is too long ago. I was in the middle before I knew that I had begun.
author: Jane Austen, Pride and Prejudice

quote: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
author: Maya Angelou, I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings

quote: Still, there are times I am bewildered by each mile I have traveled, each meal I have eaten, each person I have known, each room in which I have slept. As ordinary as it all appears, there are times when it is beyond my imagination.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri, Interpreter of Maladies

quote: And so we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Great Gatsby

quote: Hello, babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. At the outside, babies, you've got about a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies—God damn it, you've got to be kind.
author: Kurt Vonnegut, God Bless You, Mr. Rosewater

quote: He stepped down, trying not to look long at her, as if she were the sun, yet he saw her, like the sun, even without looking.
author: Leo Tolstoy, Anna Karenina

quote: As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once.
author: John Green, The Fault In Our Stars

quote: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
author: Anne Frank, The Diary of a Young Girl

quote: I took a deep breath and listened to the old brag of my heart: I am, I am, I am.
author: Sylvia Plath, The Bell Jar

quote: You call yourself a free spirit, a 'wild thing,' and you're terrified somebody's gonna stick you in a cage. Well baby, you're already in that cage. You built it yourself. And it's not bounded in the west by Tulip, Texas, or in the east by Somali-land. It's wherever you go. Because no matter where you run, you just end up running into yourself.
author: Truman Capote, Breakfast at Tiffany's

quote: It was times like these when I thought my father, who hated guns and had never been to any wars, was the bravest man who ever lived.
author: Harper Lee, To Kill A Mockingbird

quote: Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart.
author: Haruki Murakami, Kafka on the Shore

quote: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go...
author: Dr. Seuss, Oh, The Places You'll Go!

quote: Do I love you? My God, if your love were a grain of sand, mine would be a universe of beaches.
author: William Goldman, The Princess Bride

quote: There is a loneliness that can be rocked. Arms crossed, knees drawn up, holding, holding on, this motion, unlike a ship's, smooths and contains the rocker. It's an inside kind — wrapped tight like skin. Then there is the loneliness that roams. No rocking can hold it down. It is alive. On its own. A dry and spreading thing that makes the sound of one's own feet going seem to come from a far-off place.
author: Toni Morrison, Beloved

quote: Love is the longing for the half of ourselves we have lost.
author: Milan Kundera, The Unbearable Lightness of Being

quote: We’ve all got both light and dark inside us. What matters is the part we choose to act on. That’s who we really are.
author: J. K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

quote: Get busy living or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King, The Shawshank Redemption

quote: All that is gold does not glitter,Not all those who wander are lost;The old that is strong does not wither,Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring

quote: My advice is, never do tomorrow what you can do today. Procrastination is the thief of time.
author: Charles Dickens, David Copperfield

quote: He's more myself than I am. Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
author: Emily Brontë, Wuthering Heights

quote: And now that you don’t have to be perfect, you can be good.
author: John Steinbeck, East of Eden

quote: There are darknesses in life and there are lights, and you are one of the lights, the light of all lights.
author: Bram Stroker, Dracula

quote: Only connect.
author: E. M. Foster, Howard's End

quote: Those who don’t believe in magic will never find it.
author: Roald Dahl, The Minpins

quote: Be yourself and people will like you.
author: Jeff Kinney, Diary of a Wimpy Kid

quote: It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not.
author: André Gide, Autumn Leaves

quote: Sometimes weak and wan, sometimes strong and full of light. The moon understands what it means to be human.
author: Tahereh Mafi, Shatter Me

quote: The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease forever to be able to do it.
author: J.M. Barrie, Peter Pan

quote: I don’t understand it any more than you do, but one thing I’ve learned is that you don’t have to understand things for them to be.
author: Madeleine L’Engle, A Wrinkle in Time
